Hiring hashtag#Fullstack_Engineer for our client in hashtag#India hashtag#remoteInterested and eligible candidates share your resume to recruitment@daimlinc.comLocation -RemotePay rate: 24 to 25 LPAShift Timings: EST time-zoneExperience 6 to 8 YearsAbout the Role: We are seeking a Full-stack Senior Software Engineer to join our fast-paced, customer-centric Digital Experience Team. This team is focused on enhancing the experience for customers subscribed to our monthly subscription programs. Every month, our client delivers over 2MM subscriptions, excluding commerce shipments. With such high volume, we face exciting challenges and opportunities in personalization and engagement.Your objective will be to design and implement innovative solutions and product features while supporting live operations of user-facing critical web flows at scale.Nice-to-Have:· Experience with high-traffic, mission-critical digital products.· Knowledge of marketing platforms.What You'll Be Doing:· Develop product features in a full-stack environment using technologies like React, Next.js, Node.js, GraphQL, tRPC, and Java with Spring Boot.· Work on micro-frontend SPA architectures.· Integrate with composable web platforms such as Netlify and Vercel.· Participate in the prioritization process to identify and address hidden technical needs.· Translate business requirements into technical specifications with strong communication skills.· Mentor junior engineers and help them grow their skills.· Contribute to building a strong customer data platform to enable extreme personalization across digital touchpoints.· Create scalable, easy-to-maintain software that supports millions of users and transactions.What We're Looking For:· Strong experience building front-end apps with JavaScript, Next.js, ReactJS, and Node.js, as well as backend systems using object-oriented programming languages like Java.· Knowledge of Spring or similar frameworks.· Experience with micro-frontend architecture.· Familiarity with BFF (Backend-for-Frontend) design patterns.· A creative and precise problem-solver who adapts quickly to changing requirements in a fast-paced environment.· Understanding of digital product/UX design.· Experience with AWS.· Proficiency in CI/CD pipeline configuration using Jenkins.· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering.Bonus If You Have:· Experience in subscription and/or e-commerce companies.· Background in fast-paced startup environments.· Familiarity with content, personalization, and CDP tools like Contentful, Ninetailed, and Segment.io.· Experience working with Mulesoft APIs.· Proficiency in composable web platforms like Netlify and Vercel.· Knowledge of Kubernetes.· Experience with message publishing, data queues, and serverless functions.· Experience configuring Kong API Gateway.

With such high volume, we face exciting challenges and opportunities in personalization and engagement.Your objective will be to design and implement innovative solutions and product features while Integrate with composable web platforms such as Netlify and Vercel.· Participate in the prioritization process to identify and address hidden technical needs.· Translate business requirements into technical specifications with strong communication skills.· Mentor junior engineers and help them grow their skills.· Contribute to building a strong customer data platform to enable extreme personalization across digital touchpoints.· Create scalable, easy-to-maintain software that supports millions of users and transactions.What We're Looking For:· Strong experience building front-end apps with JavaScript, Next.js, ReactJS, and Node.js, as well as backend systems using object-oriented programming languages like Java.· Knowledge of Spring or similar frameworks.· Experience with micro-frontend architecture.· Familiarity with BFF (Backend-for-Frontend) design patterns.· A creative and precise problem-solver who adapts quickly to changing requirements in a fast-paced environment.· Understanding of digital product/UX design.· Experience with AWS.· Proficiency in CI/CD pipeline configuration using Jenkins.· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering.Bonus If You Have:· Experience in subscription and/or e-commerce companies.· Background in fast-paced startup environments.· Familiarity with content, personalization, and CDP tools like Contentful, Ninetailed, and Segment.io.· Experience working with Mulesoft APIs.· Proficiency in composable web platforms like Netlify and Vercel.· Knowledge of Kubernetes.· Experience with message publishing, data queues, and serverless functions.· Experience configuring Kong API Gateway.

With such high volume, we face exciting challenges and opportunities in personalization and engagement.Your objective will be to design and implement innovative solutions and product features while technical specifications with strong communication skills.· Mentor junior engineers and help them grow their skills.· Contribute to building a strong customer data platform to enable extreme personalization across digital touchpoints.· Create scalable, easy-to-maintain software that supports millions of users and transactions.What We're Looking For:· Strong experience building front-end apps with JavaScript, Next.js, ReactJS, and Node.js, as well as backend systems using object-oriented programming languages like Java.· Knowledge of Spring or similar frameworks.· Experience with micro-frontend architecture.· Familiarity with BFF (Backend-for-Frontend) design patterns.· A creative and precise problem-solver who adapts quickly to changing requirements in a fast-paced environment.· Understanding of digital product/UX design.· Experience with AWS.· Proficiency in CI/CD pipeline configuration using Jenkins.· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering.Bonus If You Have:· Experience in subscription and/or e-commerce companies.· Background in fast-paced startup environments.· Familiarity with content, personalization, and CDP tools like Contentful, Ninetailed, and Segment.io.· Experience working with Mulesoft APIs.· Proficiency in composable web platforms like Netlify and Vercel.· Knowledge of Kubernetes.· Experience with message publishing, data queues, and serverless functions.· Experience configuring Kong API Gateway.

වෙහෙසිලා, (මෙතැනදී මම උදාහරනෙකට කියන්නේ Doctor කෙනෙක් වගේ උනත් ගත්තොත් ), ඊට පස්සේ එයාගේ අදාල industry එකට එනවා, ආවම සමහරවිට තියෙන්නේ දුක්කිත තත්වයක්.. දෙන service එකේ හැටියට ලගින්වත් තියන්න බැරි salary එකක් හම්බෙන්නේ ගොඩක් fields වල ලංකාවේ වගේ රටක. 🥹 IT professionals ල තමයි මේ රටේ ගොඩක්ම වාසනාවන්ත සහ සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන පිරිස. ඒකට හේතු තියනව. 🫡  - ඔබ අවරුදු 4ක degree එකක් හරියට කරලා හරියට skill එක හදාගත්තනම්, ඔබට ඒ skill එකට තමන්ගේ හරියන්නම industry එකේ ජොබ් එක හම්බෙනවා. ඇයි ඒ? හේතුව තමයි පුතා options වැඩි සහ most importantly ඔයාට රජය එක්ක job එක කියන දේට එද්දී ගනුදෙනුවක් නැහැ. රජය හව්ල් නැති තැනක් තියනවනම් මම දකින්නේ එතන වැඩ smooth සහ employees ල උනත් සතුටින්, highly efficient විදියට වැඩ(අදෝනා, දුක් ගැනවිලි, පඩි ප්‍රශ්න නැත.) දැන් බලන්නල, ලගදි උනත් ඔය IT Field එකේ අයට ප්‍රශ්නයක් ආවනම් ආවේ ලංකාවේ ඇතුලේ Firms වල වැඩ කරන LKR salary ගන්න අයට 36% රජයෙන් බදු. සහ ලංකාවෙන් එලියට work කරල Dollar salary ගන්න අයට අලුතෙන් tax එකක් ගැහුව නොතිබුන. කොහොමහරි කියන්න ඕන උනේ බලන්න මගේ පුතේ Government ඒකත් ආයේ ආයේ ලංකාවේම Government එක හරහාම එන option එකක්. ඉතින් ඒ කියන්නේ සදා කල් රට බින්දුවට යනවනම් උබත් උබේ පව්ලත් බින්දුවට යන්න බලන් ඉන්න ඕන. රට පොඩ්ඩක් උඩට එනවනම් විතරමයි ගොඩක් මේ අනිත් fields වල professionals ලට පොඩ්ඩක් හරි උඩට එන්න පුළුවන් හෝ ටිකක් හරි comfortable life එකකට යන්න පුළුවන්. 😎 💰 මෙතැනදී IT FIeld එකේ අයට ඇත්තම කතාවනම් සැහෙන්න cushion එකක් තියනවා. හේතුව options වැඩි සහ opitons වෙහෙසිලා, (මෙතැනදී මම උදාහරනෙකට කියන්නේ Doctor කෙනෙක් වගේ උනත් ගත්තොත් ), ඊට පස්සේ එයාගේ අදාල industry එකට එනවා, ආවම සමහරවිට තියෙන්නේ දුක්කිත තත්වයක්.. දෙන service එකේ හැටියට ලගින්වත් තියන්න බැරි salary එකක් හම්බෙන්නේ ගොඩක් fields වල ලංකාවේ වගේ රටක. 🥹 IT professionals ල තමයි මේ රටේ ගොඩක්ම වාසනාවන්ත සහ සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන පිරිස. ඒකට හේතු තියනව. 🫡  - ඔබ අවරුදු 4ක degree එකක් හරියට කරලා හරියට skill එක හදාගත්තනම්, ඔබට ඒ skill එකට තමන්ගේ හරියන්නම industry එකේ ජොබ් එක හම්බෙනවා. ඇයි ඒ? හේතුව තමයි පුතා options වැඩි සහ most importantly ඔයාට රජය එක්ක job එක කියන දේට එද්දී ගනුදෙනුවක් නැහැ. රජය හව්ල් නැති තැනක් තියනවනම් මම දකින්නේ එතන වැඩ smooth සහ employees ල උනත් සතුටින්, highly efficient විදියට වැඩ(අදෝනා, දුක් ගැනවිලි, පඩි ප්‍රශ්න නැත.) දැන් බලන්නල, ලගදි උනත් ඔය IT Field එකේ අයට ප්‍රශ්නයක් ආවනම් ආවේ ලංකාවේ ඇතුලේ Firms වල වැඩ කරන LKR salary ගන්න අයට 36% රජයෙන් බදු. සහ ලංකාවෙන් එලියට work කරල Dollar salary ගන්න අයට අලුතෙන් tax එකක් ගැහුව නොතිබුන. කොහොමහරි කියන්න ඕන උනේ බලන්න මගේ පුතේ Government ඒකත් ආයේ ආයේ ලංකාවේම Government එක හරහාම එන option එකක්. ඉතින් ඒ කියන්නේ සදා කල් රට බින්දුවට යනවනම් උබත් උබේ පව්ලත් බින්දුවට යන්න බලන් ඉන්න ඕන. රට පොඩ්ඩක් උඩට එනවනම් විතරමයි ගොඩක් මේ අනිත් fields වල professionals ලට පොඩ්ඩක් හරි උඩට එන්න පුළුවන් හෝ ටිකක් හරි comfortable life එකකට යන්න පුළුවන්. 😎 💰 මෙතැනදී IT FIeld එකේ අයට ඇත්තම කතාවනම් සැහෙන්න cushion එකක් තියනවා. හේතුව options වැඩි සහ opitons 🚀 Mastering Java Collection Framework for Interviews & DevelopmentOne of the most frequently asked topics in Java interviews is the Collection Framework. Understanding its hierarchy and use cases is crucial for writing efficient code. Let’s break it down! 1️⃣ Foundation: Collection Framework OverviewThe Java Collection Framework (JCF) provides a standard architecture for storing and manipulating data.✅ Collection<E> → Root interface for Lists, Sets & Queues✅ Map<K, V> → Stores key-value pairs (not part of Collection)2️⃣ Lists – Ordered & Allows DuplicatesUsed when insertion order matters.✔ ArrayList – Fast random access (O(1) get).✔ LinkedList – Efficient insertions/deletions.✔ Stack – LIFO structure (extends Vector).🔹 Interview Question: Why is ArrayList preferred over LinkedList?👉 Use ArrayList for fast lookups, LinkedList for frequent insertions.3️⃣ Sets – Unique Elements (No Duplicates)✔ HashSet – Unordered, backed by HashMap.✔ LinkedHashSet – Maintains insertion order.✔ TreeSet – Sorted order, O(log N) operations.🔹 Q: How does HashSet ensure uniqueness?👉 Uses hashing internally to store elements.4️⃣ Queues & Deques – FIFO/LIFO✔ PriorityQueue – Elements sorted via heap.✔ ArrayDeque – Efficient queue & stack ops.🔹 Q: How does PriorityQueue maintain sorting?👉 Uses binary heap internally.5️⃣ Maps – Key-Value Pairs (Not in Collection Interface)✔ HashMap – Fast lookups, O(1) avg time.✔ TreeMap – Sorted keys, O(log N) operations.✔ ConcurrentHashMap – Thread-safe alternative to HashMap.🔹 Q: Why prefer ConcurrentHashMap over Hashtable?👉 Less locking, better performance in concurrency.🔍 Why It’s Important?Java interviews often expect in-depth knowledge of ArrayList, HashMap, HashSet, and their internal workings.💡 I personally referred to Shrayansh Jain’s Collection Framework videos & Riddhi Dutta’s Collection Framework video, during my interview preparation! Do watch them if you need in-depth understanding. I've been sharing essential Core Java resources for interview preparation. Follow me to stay updated with more insights and ace your interviews! 🎯 Happy Learning!hashtag#Java hashtag#Collections hashtag#CodingInterviews hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Hashing hashtag#SystemDesign 🚀

IT Professionals , මොනව උනත් සතුටු විය යුතුම පිරිසක් ලංකාවේ ඉන්න. පුතා, ඔයාල දන්නවද අද වෙද්දී ලංකාවේ කොච්චර පිරිසක් unhappy ද කියල කරන ජොබ් එක ගැන, සමහරවිට අවරුදු 4ක් අපි වගේම හෝ ඊටත් වඩා degrees වලට වෙහෙසිලා, (මෙතැනදී මම උදාහරනෙකට කියන්නේ Doctor කෙනෙක් වගේ උනත් ගත්තොත් ), ඊට පස්සේ එයාගේ අදාල industry එකට එනවා, ආවම සමහරවිට තියෙන්නේ දුක්කිත තත්වයක්.. දෙන service එකේ හැටියට ලගින්වත් තියන්න බැරි salary එකක් හම්බෙන්නේ ගොඩක් fields වල ලංකාවේ වගේ රටක. 🥹 IT professionals ල තමයි මේ රටේ ගොඩක්ම වාසනාවන්ත සහ සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන පිරිස. ඒකට හේතු තියනව. 🫡  - ඔබ අවරුදු 4ක degree එකක් හරියට කරලා හරියට skill එක හදාගත්තනම්, ඔබට ඒ skill එකට තමන්ගේ හරියන්නම industry එකේ ජොබ් එක හම්බෙනවා. ඇයි ඒ? හේතුව තමයි පුතා options වැඩි සහ most importantly ඔයාට රජය එක්ක job එක කියන දේට එද්දී ගනුදෙනුවක් නැහැ. රජය හව්ල් නැති තැනක් තියනවනම් මම දකින්නේ එතන වැඩ smooth සහ employees ල උනත් සතුටින්, highly efficient විදියට වැඩ(අදෝනා, දුක් ගැනවිලි, පඩි ප්‍රශ්න නැත.) දැන් බලන්නල, ලගදි උනත් ඔය IT Field එකේ අයට ප්‍රශ්නයක් ආවනම් ආවේ ලංකාවේ ඇතුලේ Firms වල වැඩ කරන LKR salary ගන්න අයට 36% රජයෙන් බදු. සහ ලංකාවෙන් එලියට work කරල Dollar salary ගන්න අයට අලුතෙන් tax එකක් ගැහුව නොතිබුන. කොහොමහරි කියන්න ඕන උනේ බලන්න මගේ පුතේ Government එකක් හව්ල් උනොත් හෝ සම්භන්ධතාවයක් ඇති උනොත් එතන අවුලක්. 🤣 ඉතින් IT Professionals ල පට්ට සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන, තමන්ට ගොඩක් options තියන එක ගැන. ලංකාවේ 99% අනෙකුත් field වලට එහෙම options අඩුයි පුතා. තිබ්බත් 🚀 Mastering Java Collection Framework for Interviews & DevelopmentOne of the most frequently asked topics in Java interviews is the Collection Framework. Understanding its hierarchy and use cases is crucial for writing efficient code. Let’s break it down! 1️⃣ Foundation: Collection Framework OverviewThe Java Collection Framework (JCF) provides a standard architecture for storing and manipulating data.✅ Collection<E> → Root interface for Lists, Sets & Queues✅ Map<K, V> → Stores key-value pairs (not part of Collection)2️⃣ Lists – Ordered & Allows DuplicatesUsed when insertion order matters.✔ ArrayList – Fast random access (O(1) get).✔ LinkedList – Efficient insertions/deletions.✔ Stack – LIFO structure (extends Vector).🔹 Interview Question: Why is ArrayList preferred over LinkedList?👉 Use ArrayList for fast lookups, LinkedList for frequent insertions.3️⃣ Sets – Unique Elements (No Duplicates)✔ HashSet – Unordered, backed by HashMap.✔ LinkedHashSet – Maintains insertion order.✔ TreeSet – Sorted order, O(log N) operations.🔹 Q: How does HashSet ensure uniqueness?👉 Uses hashing internally to store elements.4️⃣ Queues & Deques – FIFO/LIFO✔ PriorityQueue – Elements sorted via heap.✔ ArrayDeque – Efficient queue & stack ops.🔹 Q: How does PriorityQueue maintain sorting?👉 Uses binary heap internally.5️⃣ Maps – Key-Value Pairs (Not in Collection Interface)✔ HashMap – Fast lookups, O(1) avg time.✔ TreeMap – Sorted keys, O(log N) operations.✔ ConcurrentHashMap – Thread-safe alternative to HashMap.🔹 Q: Why prefer ConcurrentHashMap over Hashtable?👉 Less locking, better performance in concurrency.🔍 Why It’s Important?Java interviews often expect in-depth knowledge of ArrayList, HashMap, HashSet, and their internal workings.💡 I personally referred to Shrayansh Jain’s Collection Framework videos & Riddhi Dutta’s Collection Framework video, during my interview preparation! Do watch them if you need in-depth understanding. I've been sharing essential Core Java resources for interview preparation. Follow me to stay updated with more insights and ace your interviews! 🎯 Happy Learning!hashtag#Java hashtag#Collections hashtag#CodingInterviews hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Hashing hashtag#SystemDesign 🚀

IT Professionals , මොනව උනත් සතුටු විය යුතුම පිරිසක් ලංකාවේ ඉන්න. පුතා, ඔයාල දන්නවද අද වෙද්දී ලංකාවේ කොච්චර පිරිසක් unhappy ද කියල කරන ජොබ් එක ගැන, සමහරවිට අවරුදු 4ක් අපි වගේම හෝ ඊටත් වඩා degrees වලට වෙහෙසිලා, (මෙතැනදී මම උදාහරනෙකට කියන්නේ Doctor කෙනෙක් වගේ උනත් ගත්තොත් ), ඊට පස්සේ එයාගේ අදාල industry එකට එනවා, ආවම සමහරවිට තියෙන්නේ දුක්කිත තත්වයක්.. දෙන service එකේ හැටියට ලගින්වත් තියන්න බැරි 🚀 Mastering Java Collection Framework for Interviews & DevelopmentOne of the most frequently asked topics in Java interviews is the Collection Framework. Understanding its hierarchy and use cases is crucial for writing efficient code. Let’s break it down! 1️⃣ Foundation: Collection Framework OverviewThe Java Collection Framework (JCF) provides a standard architecture for storing and manipulating data.✅ Collection<E> → Root interface for Lists, Sets & Queues✅ Map<K, V> → Stores key-value pairs (not part of Collection)2️⃣ Lists – Ordered & Allows DuplicatesUsed when insertion order matters.✔ ArrayList – Fast random access (O(1) get).✔ LinkedList – Efficient insertions/deletions.✔ Stack – LIFO structure (extends Vector).🔹 Interview Question: Why is ArrayList preferred over LinkedList?👉 Use ArrayList for fast lookups, LinkedList for frequent insertions.3️⃣ Sets – Unique Elements (No Duplicates)✔ HashSet – Unordered, backed by HashMap.✔ LinkedHashSet – Maintains insertion order.✔ TreeSet – Sorted order, O(log N) operations.🔹 Q: How does HashSet ensure uniqueness?👉 Uses hashing internally to store elements.4️⃣ Queues & Deques – FIFO/LIFO✔ PriorityQueue – Elements sorted via heap.✔ ArrayDeque – Efficient queue & stack ops.🔹 Q: How does PriorityQueue maintain sorting?👉 Uses binary heap internally.5️⃣ Maps – Key-Value Pairs (Not in Collection Interface)✔ HashMap – Fast lookups, O(1) avg time.✔ TreeMap – Sorted keys, O(log N) operations.✔ ConcurrentHashMap – Thread-safe alternative to HashMap.🔹 Q: Why prefer ConcurrentHashMap over Hashtable?👉 Less locking, better performance in concurrency.🔍 Why It’s Important?Java interviews often expect in-depth knowledge of ArrayList, HashMap, HashSet, and their internal workings.💡 I personally referred to Shrayansh Jain’s Collection Framework videos & Riddhi Dutta’s Collection Framework video, during my interview preparation! Do watch them if you need in-depth understanding. I've been sharing essential Core Java resources for interview preparation. Follow me to stay updated with more insights and ace your interviews! 🎯 Happy Learning!hashtag#Java hashtag#Collections hashtag#CodingInterviews hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Hashing hashtag#SystemDesign 🚀

Hiring hashtag#Fullstack_Engineer for our client in hashtag#India hashtag#remoteInterested and eligible candidates share your resume to recruitment@daimlinc.comLocation -RemotePay rate: 24 to 25 LPAShift Timings: EST time-zoneExperience 6 to 8 YearsAbout the Role: We are seeking a Full-stack Senior Software Engineer to join our fast-paced, customer-centric Digital Experience Team. This team is focused on enhancing the experience for customers subscribed to our monthly subscription programs. Every month, our client delivers over 2MM subscriptions, excluding commerce shipments. With such high volume, we face exciting challenges and opportunities in personalization and engagement.Your objective will be to design and implement innovative solutions and product features while supporting live operations of user-facing critical web flows at scale.Nice-to-Have:· Experience with high-traffic, mission-critical digital products.· Knowledge of marketing platforms.What You'll Be Doing:· Develop product features in a full-stack environment using technologies like React, Next.js, Node.js, GraphQL, tRPC, and Java with Spring Boot.· Work on micro-frontend SPA architectures.· Integrate with composable web platforms such as Netlify and Vercel.· Participate in the prioritization process to identify and address hidden technical needs.· Translate business requirements into technical specifications with strong communication skills.· Mentor junior engineers and help them grow their skills.· Contribute to building a strong customer data platform to enable extreme personalization across digital touchpoints.· Create scalable, easy-to-maintain software that supports millions of users and transactions.What We're Looking For:· Strong experience building front-end apps with JavaScript, Next.js, ReactJS, and Node.js, as well as backend systems using object-oriented programming languages like Java.· Knowledge of Spring or similar frameworks.· Experience with micro-frontend architecture.· Familiarity with BFF (Backend-for-Frontend) design patterns.· A creative and precise problem-solver who adapts quickly to changing requirements in a fast-paced environment.· Understanding of digital product/UX design.· Experience with AWS.· Proficiency in CI/CD pipeline configuration using Jenkins.· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering.Bonus If You Have:· Experience in subscription and/or e-commerce companies.· Background in fast-paced startup environments.· Familiarity with content, personalization, and CDP tools like Contentful, Ninetailed, and Segment.io.· Experience working with Mulesoft APIs.· Proficiency in composable web platforms like Netlify and Vercel.· Knowledge of Kubernetes.· Experience with message publishing, data queues, and serverless functions.· Experience configuring Kong API Gateway.

IT Professionals , මොනව උනත් සතුටු විය යුතුම පිරිසක් ලංකාවේ ඉන්න. පුතා, ඔයාල දන්නවද අද වෙද්දී ලංකාවේ කොච්චර පිරිසක් unhappy ද කියල කරන ජොබ් එක ගැන, සමහරවිට අවරුදු 4ක් අපි වගේම හෝ ඊටත් වඩා degrees වලට වෙහෙසිලා, (මෙතැනදී මම උදාහරනෙකට කියන්නේ Doctor කෙනෙක් වගේ උනත් ගත්තොත් ), ඊට පස්සේ එයාගේ අදාල industry එකට එනවා, ආවම සමහරවිට තියෙන්නේ දුක්කිත තත්වයක්.. දෙන service එකේ හැටියට ලගින්වත් තියන්න බැරි salary එකක් හම්බෙන්නේ ගොඩක් fields වල ලංකාවේ වගේ රටක. 🥹 IT professionals ල තමයි මේ රටේ ගොඩක්ම වාසනාවන්ත සහ සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන පිරිස. ඒකට හේතු තියනව. 🫡  - ඔබ අවරුදු 4ක degree එකක් හරියට කරලා හරියට skill එක හදාගත්තනම්, ඔබට ඒ skill එකට තමන්ගේ හරියන්නම industry එකේ ජොබ් එක හම්බෙනවා. ඇයි ඒ? හේතුව තමයි පුතා options වැඩි සහ most importantly ඔයාට රජය එක්ක job එක කියන දේට එද්දී ගනුදෙනුවක් නැහැ. රජය හව්ල් නැති තැනක් තියනවනම් මම දකින්නේ එතන වැඩ smooth සහ employees ල උනත් සතුටින්, highly efficient විදියට වැඩ(අදෝනා, දුක් ගැනවිලි, පඩි ප්‍රශ්න නැත.) දැන් බලන්නල, ලගදි උනත් ඔය IT Field එකේ අයට ප්‍රශ්නයක් ආවනම් ආවේ ලංකාවේ ඇතුලේ Firms වල වැඩ කරන LKR salary ගන්න අයට 36% රජයෙන් බදු. සහ ලංකාවෙන් එලියට work කරල Dollar salary ගන්න අයට අලුතෙන් tax එකක් ගැහුව නොතිබුන. කොහොමහරි කියන්න ඕන උනේ බලන්න මගේ පුතේ Government 🚀 Mastering Java Collection Framework for Interviews & DevelopmentOne of the most frequently asked topics in Java interviews is the Collection Framework. Understanding its hierarchy and use cases is crucial for writing efficient code. Let’s break it down! 1️⃣ Foundation: Collection Framework OverviewThe Java Collection Framework (JCF) provides a standard architecture for storing and manipulating data.✅ Collection<E> → Root interface for Lists, Sets & Queues✅ Map<K, V> → Stores key-value pairs (not part of Collection)2️⃣ Lists – Ordered & Allows DuplicatesUsed when insertion order matters.✔ ArrayList – Fast random access (O(1) get).✔ LinkedList – Efficient insertions/deletions.✔ Stack – LIFO structure (extends Vector).🔹 Interview Question: Why is ArrayList preferred over LinkedList?👉 Use ArrayList for fast lookups, LinkedList for frequent insertions.3️⃣ Sets – Unique Elements (No Duplicates)✔ HashSet – Unordered, backed by HashMap.✔ LinkedHashSet – Maintains insertion order.✔ TreeSet – Sorted order, O(log N) operations.🔹 Q: How does HashSet ensure uniqueness?👉 Uses hashing internally to store elements.4️⃣ Queues & Deques – FIFO/LIFO✔ PriorityQueue – Elements sorted via heap.✔ ArrayDeque – Efficient queue & stack ops.🔹 Q: How does PriorityQueue maintain sorting?👉 Uses binary heap internally.5️⃣ Maps – Key-Value Pairs (Not in Collection Interface)✔ HashMap – Fast lookups, O(1) avg time.✔ TreeMap – Sorted keys, O(log N) operations.✔ ConcurrentHashMap – Thread-safe alternative to HashMap.🔹 Q: Why prefer ConcurrentHashMap over Hashtable?👉 Less locking, better performance in concurrency.🔍 Why It’s Important?Java interviews often expect in-depth knowledge of ArrayList, HashMap, HashSet, and their internal workings.💡 I personally referred to Shrayansh Jain’s Collection Framework videos & Riddhi Dutta’s Collection Framework video, during my interview preparation! Do watch them if you need in-depth understanding. I've been sharing essential Core Java resources for interview preparation. Follow me to stay updated with more insights and ace your interviews! 🎯 Happy Learning!hashtag#Java hashtag#Collections hashtag#CodingInterviews hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Hashing hashtag#SystemDesign 🚀

Post Content: Remote and hybrid teams present unique challenges for keeping employees connected and maintaining high morale. See these suggestions for managing a remote team effectively. https://bit.ly/3Xs43Zy

It’s a real shame when a potentially good candidate for a remote team member role pulls out of the selection process for a silly reason. That costs both them and their potential employer a great opportunity.Here’s a recent example.Here at Prominence Global, we were helping a client whose business is based in Australia to market a role based overseas.We sourced a large number of well-qualified candidates based in the relevant region and invited the best of them to complete a recorded video interview.Two of them withdrew, refusing to be “subjected to a video interview”.That struck me as more than a little odd for people who would most likely never meet the employer in person and all communication would be exclusively via video conferencing!What puzzling or silly reasons have you seen candidates give for withdrawing their applications?

IT Professionals , මොනව උනත් සතුටු විය යුතුම පිරිසක් ලංකාවේ ඉන්න. පුතා, ඔයාල දන්නවද අද වෙද්දී ලංකාවේ කොච්චර පිරිසක් unhappy ද කියල කරන ජොබ් එක ගැන, සමහරවිට අවරුදු 4ක් අපි වගේම හෝ ඊටත් වඩා degrees වලට වෙහෙසිලා, (මෙතැනදී මම උදාහරනෙකට කියන්නේ Doctor කෙනෙක් වගේ උනත් ගත්තොත් ), ඊට පස්සේ එයාගේ අදාල industry එකට එනවා, ආවම සමහරවිට තියෙන්නේ දුක්කිත තත්වයක්.. දෙන service එකේ හැටියට ලගින්වත් තියන්න බැරි salary එකක් හම්බෙන්නේ ගොඩක් fields වල ලංකාවේ වගේ රටක. 🥹 IT professionals ල තමයි මේ රටේ ගොඩක්ම වාසනාවන්ත සහ සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන පිරිස. ඒකට හේතු තියනව. 🫡  - ඔබ අවරුදු 4ක degree එකක් හරියට කරලා හරියට skill එක 🚀 Mastering Java Collection Framework for Interviews & DevelopmentOne of the most frequently asked topics in Java interviews is the Collection Framework. Understanding its hierarchy and use cases is crucial for writing efficient code. Let’s break it down! 1️⃣ Foundation: Collection Framework OverviewThe Java Collection Framework (JCF) provides a standard architecture for storing and manipulating data.✅ Collection<E> → Root interface for Lists, Sets & Queues✅ Map<K, V> → Stores key-value pairs (not part of Collection)2️⃣ Lists – Ordered & Allows DuplicatesUsed when insertion order matters.✔ ArrayList – Fast random access (O(1) get).✔ LinkedList – Efficient insertions/deletions.✔ Stack – LIFO structure (extends Vector).🔹 Interview Question: Why is ArrayList preferred over LinkedList?👉 Use ArrayList for fast lookups, LinkedList for frequent insertions.3️⃣ Sets – Unique Elements (No Duplicates)✔ HashSet – Unordered, backed by HashMap.✔ LinkedHashSet – Maintains insertion order.✔ TreeSet – Sorted order, O(log N) operations.🔹 Q: How does HashSet ensure uniqueness?👉 Uses hashing internally to store elements.4️⃣ Queues & Deques – FIFO/LIFO✔ PriorityQueue – Elements sorted via heap.✔ ArrayDeque – Efficient queue & stack ops.🔹 Q: How does PriorityQueue maintain sorting?👉 Uses binary heap internally.5️⃣ Maps – Key-Value Pairs (Not in Collection Interface)✔ HashMap – Fast lookups, O(1) avg time.✔ TreeMap – Sorted keys, O(log N) operations.✔ ConcurrentHashMap – Thread-safe alternative to HashMap.🔹 Q: Why prefer ConcurrentHashMap over Hashtable?👉 Less locking, better performance in concurrency.🔍 Why It’s Important?Java interviews often expect in-depth knowledge of ArrayList, HashMap, HashSet, and their internal workings.💡 I personally referred to Shrayansh Jain’s Collection Framework videos & Riddhi Dutta’s Collection Framework video, during my interview preparation! Do watch them if you need in-depth understanding. I've been sharing essential Core Java resources for interview preparation. Follow me to stay updated with more insights and ace your interviews! 🎯 Happy Learning!hashtag#Java hashtag#Collections hashtag#CodingInterviews hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Hashing hashtag#SystemDesign 🚀

Post Content: Remote and hybrid teams present unique challenges for keeping employees connected and maintaining high morale. See these suggestions for managing a remote team effectively. https://bit.ly/3Xs43Zy

It’s a real shame when a potentially good candidate for a remote team member role pulls out of the selection process for a silly reason. That costs both them and their potential employer a great opportunity.Here’s a recent example.Here at Prominence Global, we were helping a client whose business is based in Australia to market a role based overseas.We sourced a large number of well-qualified candidates based in the relevant region and invited the best of them to complete a recorded video interview.Two of them withdrew, refusing to be “subjected to a video interview”.That struck me as more than a little odd for people who would most likely never meet the employer in person and all communication would be exclusively via video conferencing!What puzzling or silly reasons have you seen candidates give for withdrawing their applications?

Username: Gilmar Rodrigues de SousaGilmar Rodrigues de Sousa
Post Content:
The shift to remote work has been a game-changer for many professionals, especially those balancing family life and career. For parents, particularly those with babies and young children, working from home offers a level of flexibility that was previously unimaginable. It allows us to be present for key moments, whether it's attending to a newborn’s needs or simply spending quality time with loved ones.Remote work has provided the opportunity to eliminate long commutes, freeing up valuable time that can now be spent on family priorities. This not only enhances work-life balance, but also leads to increased productivity. The ability to create a more comfortable and personalized work environment makes it easier to focus on professional tasks while meeting family needs.For recruiters, this demonstrates the growing value of offering flexible work options. It empowers employees to thrive in both their professional and personal lives, creating a motivated and loyal workforce. The future of work is not just about being in the office—it's about trusting employees to manage their time effectively and perform at their best, no matter where they are.

𝐖𝐨𝐫𝐤𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 in Greeneville , United States.Looking for your next workation destination? Greeneville might be the unexpected gem you've been searching for! Here are three compelling reasons why digital nomads and remote workers should consider this charming town:Greeneville offers the perfect blend of natural beauty and history, allowing digital nomads to strike a balance between work and leisure. Whether you're strolling through the historic downtown or exploring the nearby Great Smoky Mountains National Park, the fresh air and stunning scenery provide the perfect backdrop for a productive yet relaxing workation.Despite its quaint size, Greeneville packs a punch when it comes to amenities for remote workers. Many local hotels cater specifically to digital nomads, offering rooms equipped with desks, ergonomic chairs, and high-speed internet. You can easily find a comfortable spot to hunker down and get work done, all while enjoying the warmth of Southern hospitality.Greeneville's low cost of living compared to major cities makes it a budget-friendly option for remote workers seeking an extended stay. From affordable dining to reasonably priced accommodations, you’ll find it easy to stretch your budget further without compromising on the quality of your workation experience.Discover why Greeneville is the ideal spot for your next workation and experience the perfect blend of work, adventure, and relaxation.hashtag#GreenevilleWorkation hashtag#DigitalNomadLife hashtag#RemoteWorkUSA

With such high volume, we face exciting challenges and opportunities in personalization and engagement.Your objective will be to design and implement innovative solutions and product features while supporting live operations of user-facing critical web flows at scale.Nice-to-Have:· Experience with high-traffic, mission-critical digital products.· Knowledge of marketing platforms.What You'll Be Doing:· Develop product features in a full-stack environment using technologies like React, Next.js, Node.js, GraphQL, tRPC, and Java with Spring Boot.· Work on micro-frontend SPA architectures.· Integrate with composable web platforms such as Netlify and Vercel.· Participate in the prioritization process to identify and address hidden technical needs.· Translate business requirements into technical specifications with strong communication skills.· Mentor junior engineers and help them grow their skills.· Contribute to building a strong customer data platform to enable extreme personalization across digital touchpoints.· Create scalable, easy-to-maintain software that supports millions of users and transactions.What We're Looking For:· Strong experience building front-end apps with JavaScript, Next.js, ReactJS, and Node.js, as well as backend systems using object-oriented programming languages like Java.· Knowledge of Spring or similar frameworks.· Experience with micro-frontend architecture.· Familiarity with BFF (Backend-for-Frontend) design patterns.· A creative and precise problem-solver who adapts quickly to changing requirements in a fast-paced environment.· Understanding of digital product/UX design.· Experience with AWS.· Proficiency in CI/CD pipeline configuration using Jenkins.· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering.Bonus If You Have:· Experience in subscription and/or e-commerce companies.· Background in fast-paced startup environments.· Familiarity with content, personalization, and CDP tools like Contentful, Ninetailed, and Segment.io.· Experience working with Mulesoft APIs.· Proficiency in composable web platforms like Netlify and Vercel.· Knowledge of Kubernetes.· Experience with message publishing, data queues, and serverless functions.· Experience configuring Kong API Gateway.

IT Professionals , මොනව උනත් සතුටු විය යුතුම පිරිසක් ලංකාවේ ඉන්න. පුතා, ඔයාල දන්නවද අද වෙද්දී ලංකාවේ කොච්චර පිරිසක් unhappy ද කියල කරන ජොබ් එක ගැන, සමහරවිට අවරුදු 4ක් අපි වගේම හෝ ඊටත් වඩා degrees වලට වෙහෙසිලා, (මෙතැනදී මම උදාහරනෙකට කියන්නේ Doctor කෙනෙක් වගේ උනත් ගත්තොත් ), ඊට පස්සේ එයාගේ අදාල industry එකට එනවා, ආවම සමහරවිට තියෙන්නේ දුක්කිත තත්වයක්.. දෙන service එකේ හැටියට ලගින්වත් තියන්න බැරි salary එකක් හම්බෙන්නේ ගොඩක් fields වල ලංකාවේ වගේ රටක. 🥹 IT professionals ල තමයි මේ රටේ ගොඩක්ම වාසනාවන්ත සහ සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන පිරිස. ඒකට හේතු තියනව. 🫡  - ඔබ අවරුදු 4ක degree එකක් හරියට කරලා හරියට skill එක හදාගත්තනම්, ඔබට ඒ skill එකට තමන්ගේ හරියන්නම industry එකේ ජොබ් එක හම්බෙනවා. ඇයි ඒ? හේතුව තමයි පුතා options වැඩි සහ most importantly ඔයාට රජය එක්ක job එක කියන දේට එද්දී ගනුදෙනුවක් නැහැ. රජය හව්ල් නැති තැනක් තියනවනම් මම දකින්නේ එතන වැඩ smooth සහ employees ල උනත් සතුටින්, highly efficient විදියට වැඩ(අදෝනා, දුක් ගැනවිලි, පඩි ප්‍රශ්න නැත.) දැන් බලන්නල, ලගදි උනත් ඔය IT Field එකේ අයට ප්‍රශ්නයක් ආවනම් ආවේ ලංකාවේ ඇතුලේ Firms වල වැඩ කරන LKR salary ගන්න අයට 36% රජයෙන් බදු. සහ ලංකාවෙන් එලියට work කරල Dollar salary ගන්න අයට අලුතෙන් tax එකක් ගැහුව නොතිබුන. කොහොමහරි කියන්න ඕන උනේ බලන්න මගේ පුතේ Government එකක් හව්ල් උනොත් හෝ සම්භන්ධතාවයක් ඇති උනොත් එතන අවුලක්. 🤣 ඉතින් IT Professionals ල පට්ට සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන, තමන්ට ගොඩක් options තියන එක ගැන. ලංකාවේ 99% අනෙකුත් field වලට එහෙම options අඩුයි පුතා. තිබ්බත් ඒකත් ආයේ ආයේ ලංකාවේම Government එක හරහාම එන option එකක්. ඉතින් ඒ කියන්නේ සදා කල් රට බින්දුවට යනවනම් උබත් උබේ පව්ලත් බින්දුවට යන්න බලන් ඉන්න ඕන. රට පොඩ්ඩක් උඩට එනවනම් විතරමයි ගොඩක් මේ අනිත් fields වල 🚀 Mastering Java Collection Framework for Interviews & DevelopmentOne of the most frequently asked topics in Java interviews is the Collection Framework. Understanding its hierarchy and use cases is crucial for writing efficient code. Let’s break it down! 1️⃣ Foundation: Collection Framework OverviewThe Java Collection Framework (JCF) provides a standard architecture for storing and manipulating data.✅ Collection<E> → Root interface for Lists, Sets & Queues✅ Map<K, V> → Stores key-value pairs (not part of Collection)2️⃣ Lists – Ordered & Allows DuplicatesUsed when insertion order matters.✔ ArrayList – Fast random access (O(1) get).✔ LinkedList – Efficient insertions/deletions.✔ Stack – LIFO structure (extends Vector).🔹 Interview Question: Why is ArrayList preferred over LinkedList?👉 Use ArrayList for fast lookups, LinkedList for frequent insertions.3️⃣ Sets – Unique Elements (No Duplicates)✔ HashSet – Unordered, backed by HashMap.✔ LinkedHashSet – Maintains insertion order.✔ TreeSet – Sorted order, O(log N) operations.🔹 Q: How does HashSet ensure uniqueness?👉 Uses hashing internally to store elements.4️⃣ Queues & Deques – FIFO/LIFO✔ PriorityQueue – Elements sorted via heap.✔ ArrayDeque – Efficient queue & stack ops.🔹 Q: How does PriorityQueue maintain sorting?👉 Uses binary heap internally.5️⃣ Maps – Key-Value Pairs (Not in Collection Interface)✔ HashMap – Fast lookups, O(1) avg time.✔ TreeMap – Sorted keys, O(log N) operations.✔ ConcurrentHashMap – Thread-safe alternative to HashMap.🔹 Q: Why prefer ConcurrentHashMap over Hashtable?👉 Less locking, better performance in concurrency.🔍 Why It’s Important?Java interviews often expect in-depth knowledge of ArrayList, HashMap, HashSet, and their internal workings.💡 I personally referred to Shrayansh Jain’s Collection Framework videos & Riddhi Dutta’s Collection Framework video, during my interview preparation! Do watch them if you need in-depth understanding. I've been sharing essential Core Java resources for interview preparation. Follow me to stay updated with more insights and ace your interviews! 🎯 Happy Learning!hashtag#Java hashtag#Collections hashtag#CodingInterviews hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Hashing hashtag#SystemDesign 🚀

Username: George J Atiee II, MSAGeorge J Atiee II, MSA
Post Content: Remote and hybrid teams present unique challenges for keeping employees connected and maintaining high morale. See these suggestions for managing a remote team effectively. https://bit.ly/3Xs43Zy

It’s a real shame when a potentially good candidate for a remote team member role pulls out of the selection process for a silly reason. That costs both them and their potential employer a great opportunity.Here’s a recent example.Here at Prominence Global, we were helping a client whose business is based in Australia to market a role based overseas.We sourced a large number of well-qualified candidates based in the relevant region and invited the best of them to complete a recorded video interview.Two of them withdrew, refusing to be “subjected to a video interview”.That struck me as more than a little odd for people who would most likely never meet the employer in person and all communication would be exclusively via video conferencing!What puzzling or silly reasons have you seen candidates give for withdrawing their applications?

Username: Gilmar Rodrigues de SousaGilmar Rodrigues de Sousa
Post Content:
The shift to remote work has been a game-changer for many professionals, especially those balancing family life and career. For parents, particularly those with babies and young children, working from home offers a level of flexibility that was previously unimaginable. It allows us to be present for key moments, whether it's attending to a newborn’s needs or simply spending quality time with loved ones.Remote work has provided the opportunity to eliminate long commutes, freeing up valuable time that can now be spent on family priorities. This not only enhances work-life balance, but also leads to increased productivity. The ability to create a more comfortable and personalized work environment makes it easier to focus on professional tasks while meeting family needs.For recruiters, this demonstrates the growing value of offering flexible work options. It empowers employees to thrive in both their professional and personal lives, creating a motivated and loyal workforce. The future of work is not just about being in the office—it's about trusting employees to manage their time effectively and perform at their best, no matter where they are.

වෙහෙසිලා, (මෙතැනදී මම උදාහරනෙකට කියන්නේ Doctor කෙනෙක් වගේ උනත් ගත්තොත් ), ඊට පස්සේ එයාගේ අදාල industry එකට එනවා, ආවම සමහරවිට තියෙන්නේ දුක්කිත තත්වයක්.. දෙන service එකේ හැටියට ලගින්වත් තියන්න බැරි salary එකක් හම්බෙන්නේ ගොඩක් fields වල ලංකාවේ වගේ රටක. 🥹 IT professionals ල තමයි මේ රටේ ගොඩක්ම වාසනාවන්ත සහ සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන පිරිස. ඒකට හේතු තියනව. 🫡  - ඔබ අවරුදු 4ක degree එකක් හරියට කරලා හරියට skill එක හදාගත්තනම්, ඔබට ඒ skill එකට තමන්ගේ හරියන්නම industry එකේ ජොබ් එක හම්බෙනවා. ඇයි ඒ? හේතුව තමයි පුතා options වැඩි සහ most importantly ඔයාට රජය එක්ක job එක කියන දේට එද්දී ගනුදෙනුවක් නැහැ. රජය හව්ල් නැති තැනක් තියනවනම් මම දකින්නේ එතන වැඩ smooth සහ employees ල උනත් සතුටින්, highly efficient විදියට වැඩ(අදෝනා, දුක් ගැනවිලි, පඩි ප්‍රශ්න නැත.) දැන් බලන්නල, ලගදි උනත් ඔය IT Field එකේ අයට ප්‍රශ්නයක් ආවනම් ආවේ ලංකාවේ ඇතුලේ Firms වල වැඩ කරන LKR salary ගන්න අයට 36% රජයෙන් බදු. සහ ලංකාවෙන් එලියට work කරල Dollar salary ගන්න අයට අලුතෙන් tax එකක් ගැහුව නොතිබුන. කොහොමහරි කියන්න ඕන උනේ බලන්න මගේ පුතේ Government ඒකත් ආයේ ආයේ ලංකාවේම Government එක හරහාම එන option එකක්. ඉතින් ඒ කියන්නේ සදා කල් රට බින්දුවට යනවනම් උබත් උබේ පව්ලත් බින්දුවට යන්න බලන් ඉන්න ඕන. රට පොඩ්ඩක් උඩට එනවනම් විතරමයි ගොඩක් මේ අනිත් fields වල professionals ලට පොඩ්ඩක් හරි උඩට එන්න පුළුවන් හෝ ටිකක් හරි comfortable life එකකට යන්න පුළුවන්. 😎 💰 මෙතැනදී IT FIeld එකේ අයට ඇත්තම කතාවනම් සැහෙන්න cushion එකක් තියනවා. හේතුව options වැඩි සහ opitons 🚀 Mastering Java Collection Framework for Interviews & DevelopmentOne of the most frequently asked topics in Java interviews is the Collection Framework. Understanding its hierarchy and use cases is crucial for writing efficient code. Let’s break it down! 1️⃣ Foundation: Collection Framework OverviewThe Java Collection Framework (JCF) provides a standard architecture for storing and manipulating data.✅ Collection<E> → Root interface for Lists, Sets & Queues✅ Map<K, V> → Stores key-value pairs (not part of Collection)2️⃣ Lists – Ordered & Allows DuplicatesUsed when insertion order matters.✔ ArrayList – Fast random access (O(1) get).✔ LinkedList – Efficient insertions/deletions.✔ Stack – LIFO structure (extends Vector).🔹 Interview Question: Why is ArrayList preferred over LinkedList?👉 Use ArrayList for fast lookups, LinkedList for frequent insertions.3️⃣ Sets – Unique Elements (No Duplicates)✔ HashSet – Unordered, backed by HashMap.✔ LinkedHashSet – Maintains insertion order.✔ TreeSet – Sorted order, O(log N) operations.🔹 Q: How does HashSet ensure uniqueness?👉 Uses hashing internally to store elements.4️⃣ Queues & Deques – FIFO/LIFO✔ PriorityQueue – Elements sorted via heap.✔ ArrayDeque – Efficient queue & stack ops.🔹 Q: How does PriorityQueue maintain sorting?👉 Uses binary heap internally.5️⃣ Maps – Key-Value Pairs (Not in Collection Interface)✔ HashMap – Fast lookups, O(1) avg time.✔ TreeMap – Sorted keys, O(log N) operations.✔ ConcurrentHashMap – Thread-safe alternative to HashMap.🔹 Q: Why prefer ConcurrentHashMap over Hashtable?👉 Less locking, better performance in concurrency.🔍 Why It’s Important?Java interviews often expect in-depth knowledge of ArrayList, HashMap, HashSet, and their internal workings.💡 I personally referred to Shrayansh Jain’s Collection Framework videos & Riddhi Dutta’s Collection Framework video, during my interview preparation! Do watch them if you need in-depth understanding. I've been sharing essential Core Java resources for interview preparation. Follow me to stay updated with more insights and ace your interviews! 🎯 Happy Learning!hashtag#Java hashtag#Collections hashtag#CodingInterviews hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Hashing hashtag#SystemDesign 🚀

Post Content: Remote and hybrid teams present unique challenges for keeping employees connected and maintaining high morale. See these suggestions for managing a remote team effectively. https://bit.ly/3Xs43Zy

It’s a real shame when a potentially good candidate for a remote team member role pulls out of the selection process for a silly reason. That costs both them and their potential employer a great opportunity.Here’s a recent example.Here at Prominence Global, we were helping a client whose business is based in Australia to market a role based overseas.We sourced a large number of well-qualified candidates based in the relevant region and invited the best of them to complete a recorded video interview.Two of them withdrew, refusing to be “subjected to a video interview”.That struck me as more than a little odd for people who would most likely never meet the employer in person and all communication would be exclusively via video conferencing!What puzzling or silly reasons have you seen candidates give for withdrawing their applications?

Username: Gilmar Rodrigues de SousaGilmar Rodrigues de Sousa
Post Content:
The shift to remote work has been a game-changer for many professionals, especially those balancing family life and career. For parents, particularly those with babies and young children, working from home offers a level of flexibility that was previously unimaginable. It allows us to be present for key moments, whether it's attending to a newborn’s needs or simply spending quality time with loved ones.Remote work has provided the opportunity to eliminate long commutes, freeing up valuable time that can now be spent on family priorities. This not only enhances work-life balance, but also leads to increased productivity. The ability to create a more comfortable and personalized work environment makes it easier to focus on professional tasks while meeting family needs.For recruiters, this demonstrates the growing value of offering flexible work options. It empowers employees to thrive in both their professional and personal lives, creating a motivated and loyal workforce. The future of work is not just about being in the office—it's about trusting employees to manage their time effectively and perform at their best, no matter where they are.

IT Professionals , මොනව උනත් සතුටු විය යුතුම පිරිසක් ලංකාවේ ඉන්න. පුතා, ඔයාල දන්නවද අද වෙද්දී ලංකාවේ කොච්චර පිරිසක් unhappy ද කියල කරන ජොබ් එක ගැන, සමහරවිට අවරුදු 4ක් අපි වගේම හෝ ඊටත් වඩා degrees වලට වෙහෙසිලා, (මෙතැනදී මම උදාහරනෙකට කියන්නේ Doctor කෙනෙක් වගේ උනත් ගත්තොත් ), ඊට පස්සේ එයාගේ අදාල industry එකට එනවා, ආවම සමහරවිට තියෙන්නේ දුක්කිත තත්වයක්.. දෙන service එකේ හැටියට ලගින්වත් තියන්න බැරි salary එකක් හම්බෙන්නේ ගොඩක් fields වල ලංකාවේ වගේ රටක. 🥹 IT professionals ල තමයි මේ රටේ ගොඩක්ම වාසනාවන්ත සහ සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන පිරිස. ඒකට හේතු තියනව. 🫡  - ඔබ අවරුදු 4ක degree එකක් හරියට කරලා හරියට skill එක හදාගත්තනම්, ඔබට ඒ skill එකට තමන්ගේ හරියන්නම industry එකේ ජොබ් එක හම්බෙනවා. ඇයි ඒ? හේතුව තමයි පුතා options වැඩි සහ most importantly ඔයාට රජය එක්ක job එක කියන දේට එද්දී ගනුදෙනුවක් නැහැ. රජය හව්ල් නැති තැනක් තියනවනම් මම දකින්නේ එතන වැඩ smooth සහ employees ල උනත් සතුටින්, highly efficient විදියට වැඩ(අදෝනා, දුක් ගැනවිලි, පඩි ප්‍රශ්න නැත.) දැන් බලන්නල, ලගදි උනත් ඔය IT Field එකේ අයට ප්‍රශ්නයක් ආවනම් ආවේ ලංකාවේ ඇතුලේ Firms වල වැඩ කරන LKR salary ගන්න අයට 36% රජයෙන් බදු. සහ ලංකාවෙන් එලියට work කරල Dollar salary ගන්න අයට අලුතෙන් tax එකක් ගැහුව නොතිබුන. කොහොමහරි කියන්න ඕන උනේ බලන්න මගේ පුතේ Government එකක් හව්ල් උනොත් හෝ සම්භන්ධතාවයක් ඇති උනොත් එතන අවුලක්. 🤣 ඉතින් IT Professionals ල පට්ට සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන, තමන්ට ගොඩක් options තියන එක ගැන. ලංකාවේ 99% අනෙකුත් field වලට එහෙම options අඩුයි පුතා. තිබ්බත් ඒකත් ආයේ ආයේ ලංකාවේම Government එක හරහාම එන option එකක්. ඉතින් ඒ කියන්නේ සදා කල් රට බින්දුවට යනවනම් උබත් උබේ පව්ලත් බින්දුවට යන්න බලන් ඉන්න ඕන. රට පොඩ්ඩක් උඩට එනවනම් විතරමයි ගොඩක් මේ අනිත් fields වල 🚀 Mastering Java Collection Framework for Interviews & DevelopmentOne of the most frequently asked topics in Java interviews is the Collection Framework. Understanding its hierarchy and use cases is crucial for writing efficient code. Let’s break it down! 1️⃣ Foundation: Collection Framework OverviewThe Java Collection Framework (JCF) provides a standard architecture for storing and manipulating data.✅ Collection<E> → Root interface for Lists, Sets & Queues✅ Map<K, V> → Stores key-value pairs (not part of Collection)2️⃣ Lists – Ordered & Allows DuplicatesUsed when insertion order matters.✔ ArrayList – Fast random access (O(1) get).✔ LinkedList – Efficient insertions/deletions.✔ Stack – LIFO structure (extends Vector).🔹 Interview Question: Why is ArrayList preferred over LinkedList?👉 Use ArrayList for fast lookups, LinkedList for frequent insertions.3️⃣ Sets – Unique Elements (No Duplicates)✔ HashSet – Unordered, backed by HashMap.✔ LinkedHashSet – Maintains insertion order.✔ TreeSet – Sorted order, O(log N) operations.🔹 Q: How does HashSet ensure uniqueness?👉 Uses hashing internally to store elements.4️⃣ Queues & Deques – FIFO/LIFO✔ PriorityQueue – Elements sorted via heap.✔ ArrayDeque – Efficient queue & stack ops.🔹 Q: How does PriorityQueue maintain sorting?👉 Uses binary heap internally.5️⃣ Maps – Key-Value Pairs (Not in Collection Interface)✔ HashMap – Fast lookups, O(1) avg time.✔ TreeMap – Sorted keys, O(log N) operations.✔ ConcurrentHashMap – Thread-safe alternative to HashMap.🔹 Q: Why prefer ConcurrentHashMap over Hashtable?👉 Less locking, better performance in concurrency.🔍 Why It’s Important?Java interviews often expect in-depth knowledge of ArrayList, HashMap, HashSet, and their internal workings.💡 I personally referred to Shrayansh Jain’s Collection Framework videos & Riddhi Dutta’s Collection Framework video, during my interview preparation! Do watch them if you need in-depth understanding. I've been sharing essential Core Java resources for interview preparation. Follow me to stay updated with more insights and ace your interviews! 🎯 Happy Learning!hashtag#Java hashtag#Collections hashtag#CodingInterviews hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Hashing hashtag#SystemDesign 🚀

Username: George J Atiee II, MSAGeorge J Atiee II, MSA
Post Content: Remote and hybrid teams present unique challenges for keeping employees connected and maintaining high morale. See these suggestions for managing a remote team effectively. https://bit.ly/3Xs43Zy

It’s a real shame when a potentially good candidate for a remote team member role pulls out of the selection process for a silly reason. That costs both them and their potential employer a great opportunity.Here’s a recent example.Here at Prominence Global, we were helping a client whose business is based in Australia to market a role based overseas.We sourced a large number of well-qualified candidates based in the relevant region and invited the best of them to complete a recorded video interview.Two of them withdrew, refusing to be “subjected to a video interview”.That struck me as more than a little odd for people who would most likely never meet the employer in person and all communication would be exclusively via video conferencing!What puzzling or silly reasons have you seen candidates give for withdrawing their applications?

Username: Gilmar Rodrigues de SousaGilmar Rodrigues de Sousa
Post Content:
The shift to remote work has been a game-changer for many professionals, especially those balancing family life and career. For parents, particularly those with babies and young children, working from home offers a level of flexibility that was previously unimaginable. It allows us to be present for key moments, whether it's attending to a newborn’s needs or simply spending quality time with loved ones.Remote work has provided the opportunity to eliminate long commutes, freeing up valuable time that can now be spent on family priorities. This not only enhances work-life balance, but also leads to increased productivity. The ability to create a more comfortable and personalized work environment makes it easier to focus on professional tasks while meeting family needs.For recruiters, this demonstrates the growing value of offering flexible work options. It empowers employees to thrive in both their professional and personal lives, creating a motivated and loyal workforce. The future of work is not just about being in the office—it's about trusting employees to manage their time effectively and perform at their best, no matter where they are.

IT Professionals , මොනව උනත් සතුටු විය යුතුම පිරිසක් ලංකාවේ ඉන්න. පුතා, ඔයාල දන්නවද අද වෙද්දී ලංකාවේ කොච්චර පිරිසක් unhappy ද කියල කරන ජොබ් එක ගැන, සමහරවිට අවරුදු 4ක් අපි වගේම හෝ ඊටත් වඩා degrees වලට වෙහෙසිලා, (මෙතැනදී මම උදාහරනෙකට කියන්නේ Doctor කෙනෙක් වගේ උනත් ගත්තොත් ), ඊට පස්සේ එයාගේ අදාල industry එකට එනවා, ආවම සමහරවිට තියෙන්නේ දුක්කිත තත්වයක්.. දෙන service එකේ හැටියට ලගින්වත් තියන්න බැරි salary එකක් හම්බෙන්නේ ගොඩක් fields වල ලංකාවේ වගේ රටක. 🥹 IT professionals ල තමයි මේ රටේ ගොඩක්ම වාසනාවන්ත සහ සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන පිරිස. ඒකට හේතු තියනව. 🫡  - ඔබ අවරුදු 4ක degree එකක් හරියට කරලා හරියට skill එක 🚀 Mastering Java Collection Framework for Interviews & DevelopmentOne of the most frequently asked topics in Java interviews is the Collection Framework. Understanding its hierarchy and use cases is crucial for writing efficient code. Let’s break it down! 1️⃣ Foundation: Collection Framework OverviewThe Java Collection Framework (JCF) provides a standard architecture for storing and manipulating data.✅ Collection<E> → Root interface for Lists, Sets & Queues✅ Map<K, V> → Stores key-value pairs (not part of Collection)2️⃣ Lists – Ordered & Allows DuplicatesUsed when insertion order matters.✔ ArrayList – Fast random access (O(1) get).✔ LinkedList – Efficient insertions/deletions.✔ Stack – LIFO structure (extends Vector).🔹 Interview Question: Why is ArrayList preferred over LinkedList?👉 Use ArrayList for fast lookups, LinkedList for frequent insertions.3️⃣ Sets – Unique Elements (No Duplicates)✔ HashSet – Unordered, backed by HashMap.✔ LinkedHashSet – Maintains insertion order.✔ TreeSet – Sorted order, O(log N) operations.🔹 Q: How does HashSet ensure uniqueness?👉 Uses hashing internally to store elements.4️⃣ Queues & Deques – FIFO/LIFO✔ PriorityQueue – Elements sorted via heap.✔ ArrayDeque – Efficient queue & stack ops.🔹 Q: How does PriorityQueue maintain sorting?👉 Uses binary heap internally.5️⃣ Maps – Key-Value Pairs (Not in Collection Interface)✔ HashMap – Fast lookups, O(1) avg time.✔ TreeMap – Sorted keys, O(log N) operations.✔ ConcurrentHashMap – Thread-safe alternative to HashMap.🔹 Q: Why prefer ConcurrentHashMap over Hashtable?👉 Less locking, better performance in concurrency.🔍 Why It’s Important?Java interviews often expect in-depth knowledge of ArrayList, HashMap, HashSet, and their internal workings.💡 I personally referred to Shrayansh Jain’s Collection Framework videos & Riddhi Dutta’s Collection Framework video, during my interview preparation! Do watch them if you need in-depth understanding. I've been sharing essential Core Java resources for interview preparation. Follow me to stay updated with more insights and ace your interviews! 🎯 Happy Learning!hashtag#Java hashtag#Collections hashtag#CodingInterviews hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Hashing hashtag#SystemDesign 🚀

Post Content: Remote and hybrid teams present unique challenges for keeping employees connected and maintaining high morale. See these suggestions for managing a remote team effectively. https://bit.ly/3Xs43Zy

It’s a real shame when a potentially good candidate for a remote team member role pulls out of the selection process for a silly reason. That costs both them and their potential employer a great opportunity.Here’s a recent example.Here at Prominence Global, we were helping a client whose business is based in Australia to market a role based overseas.We sourced a large number of well-qualified candidates based in the relevant region and invited the best of them to complete a recorded video interview.Two of them withdrew, refusing to be “subjected to a video interview”.That struck me as more than a little odd for people who would most likely never meet the employer in person and all communication would be exclusively via video conferencing!What puzzling or silly reasons have you seen candidates give for withdrawing their applications?

Username: Gilmar Rodrigues de SousaGilmar Rodrigues de Sousa
Post Content:
The shift to remote work has been a game-changer for many professionals, especially those balancing family life and career. For parents, particularly those with babies and young children, working from home offers a level of flexibility that was previously unimaginable. It allows us to be present for key moments, whether it's attending to a newborn’s needs or simply spending quality time with loved ones.Remote work has provided the opportunity to eliminate long commutes, freeing up valuable time that can now be spent on family priorities. This not only enhances work-life balance, but also leads to increased productivity. The ability to create a more comfortable and personalized work environment makes it easier to focus on professional tasks while meeting family needs.For recruiters, this demonstrates the growing value of offering flexible work options. It empowers employees to thrive in both their professional and personal lives, creating a motivated and loyal workforce. The future of work is not just about being in the office—it's about trusting employees to manage their time effectively and perform at their best, no matter where they are.

supporting live operations of user-facing critical web flows at scale.Nice-to-Have:· Experience with high-traffic, mission-critical digital products.· Knowledge of marketing platforms.What You'll Be Doing:· Develop product features in a full-stack environment using technologies like React, Next.js, Node.js, GraphQL, tRPC, and Java with Spring Boot.· Work on micro-frontend SPA architectures.· Integrate with composable web platforms such as Netlify and Vercel.· Participate in the prioritization process to identify and address hidden technical needs.· Translate business requirements into technical specifications with strong communication skills.· Mentor junior engineers and help them grow their skills.· Contribute to building a strong customer data platform to enable extreme personalization across digital touchpoints.· Create scalable, easy-to-maintain software that supports millions of users and transactions.What We're Looking For:· Strong experience building front-end apps with JavaScript, Next.js, ReactJS, and Node.js, as well as backend systems using object-oriented programming languages like Java.· Knowledge of Spring or similar frameworks.· Experience with micro-frontend architecture.· Familiarity with BFF (Backend-for-Frontend) design patterns.· A creative and precise problem-solver who adapts quickly to changing requirements in a fast-paced environment.· Understanding of digital product/UX design.· Experience with AWS.· Proficiency in CI/CD pipeline configuration using Jenkins.· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering.Bonus If You Have:· Experience in subscription and/or e-commerce companies.· Background in fast-paced startup environments.· Familiarity with content, personalization, and CDP tools like Contentful, Ninetailed, and Segment.io.· Experience working with Mulesoft APIs.· Proficiency in composable web platforms like Netlify and Vercel.· Knowledge of Kubernetes.· Experience with message publishing, data queues, and serverless functions.· Experience configuring Kong API Gateway.

🚀 Mastering Java Collection Framework for Interviews & DevelopmentOne of the most frequently asked topics in Java interviews is the Collection Framework. Understanding its hierarchy and use cases is crucial for writing efficient code. Let’s break it down! 1️⃣ Foundation: Collection Framework OverviewThe Java Collection Framework (JCF) provides a standard architecture for storing and manipulating data.✅ Collection<E> → Root interface for Lists, Sets & Queues✅ Map<K, V> → Stores key-value pairs (not part of Collection)2️⃣ Lists – Ordered & Allows DuplicatesUsed when insertion order matters.✔ ArrayList – Fast random access (O(1) get).✔ LinkedList – Efficient insertions/deletions.✔ Stack – LIFO structure (extends Vector).🔹 Interview Question: Why is ArrayList preferred over LinkedList?👉 Use ArrayList for fast lookups, LinkedList for frequent insertions.3️⃣ Sets – Unique Elements (No Duplicates)✔ HashSet – Unordered, backed by HashMap.✔ LinkedHashSet – Maintains insertion order.✔ TreeSet – Sorted order, O(log N) operations.🔹 Q: How does HashSet ensure uniqueness?👉 Uses hashing internally to store elements.4️⃣ Queues & Deques – FIFO/LIFO✔ PriorityQueue – Elements sorted via heap.✔ ArrayDeque – Efficient queue & stack ops.🔹 Q: How does PriorityQueue maintain sorting?👉 Uses binary heap internally.5️⃣ Maps – Key-Value Pairs (Not in Collection Interface)✔ HashMap – Fast lookups, O(1) avg time.✔ TreeMap – Sorted keys, O(log N) operations.✔ ConcurrentHashMap – Thread-safe alternative to HashMap.🔹 Q: Why prefer ConcurrentHashMap over Hashtable?👉 Less locking, better performance in concurrency.🔍 Why It’s Important?Java interviews often expect in-depth knowledge of ArrayList, HashMap, HashSet, and their internal workings.💡 I personally referred to Shrayansh Jain’s Collection Framework videos & Riddhi Dutta’s Collection Framework video, during my interview preparation! Do watch them if you need in-depth understanding. I've been sharing essential Core Java resources for interview preparation. Follow me to stay updated with more insights and ace your interviews! 🎯 Happy Learning!hashtag#Java hashtag#Collections hashtag#CodingInterviews hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Hashing hashtag#SystemDesign 🚀

Post Content: Remote and hybrid teams present unique challenges for keeping employees connected and maintaining high morale. See these suggestions for managing a remote team effectively. https://bit.ly/3Xs43Zy

It’s a real shame when a potentially good candidate for a remote team member role pulls out of the selection process for a silly reason. That costs both them and their potential employer a great opportunity.Here’s a recent example.Here at Prominence Global, we were helping a client whose business is based in Australia to market a role based overseas.We sourced a large number of well-qualified candidates based in the relevant region and invited the best of them to complete a recorded video interview.Two of them withdrew, refusing to be “subjected to a video interview”.That struck me as more than a little odd for people who would most likely never meet the employer in person and all communication would be exclusively via video conferencing!What puzzling or silly reasons have you seen candidates give for withdrawing their applications?

Username: Gilmar Rodrigues de SousaGilmar Rodrigues de Sousa
Post Content:
The shift to remote work has been a game-changer for many professionals, especially those balancing family life and career. For parents, particularly those with babies and young children, working from home offers a level of flexibility that was previously unimaginable. It allows us to be present for key moments, whether it's attending to a newborn’s needs or simply spending quality time with loved ones.Remote work has provided the opportunity to eliminate long commutes, freeing up valuable time that can now be spent on family priorities. This not only enhances work-life balance, but also leads to increased productivity. The ability to create a more comfortable and personalized work environment makes it easier to focus on professional tasks while meeting family needs.For recruiters, this demonstrates the growing value of offering flexible work options. It empowers employees to thrive in both their professional and personal lives, creating a motivated and loyal workforce. The future of work is not just about being in the office—it's about trusting employees to manage their time effectively and perform at their best, no matter where they are.

IT Professionals , මොනව උනත් සතුටු විය යුතුම පිරිසක් ලංකාවේ ඉන්න. පුතා, ඔයාල දන්නවද අද වෙද්දී ලංකාවේ කොච්චර පිරිසක් unhappy ද කියල කරන ජොබ් එක ගැන, සමහරවිට අවරුදු 4ක් අපි වගේම හෝ ඊටත් වඩා degrees වලට වෙහෙසිලා, (මෙතැනදී මම උදාහරනෙකට කියන්නේ Doctor කෙනෙක් වගේ උනත් ගත්තොත් ), ඊට පස්සේ එයාගේ අදාල industry එකට එනවා, ආවම සමහරවිට තියෙන්නේ දුක්කිත තත්වයක්.. දෙන service එකේ හැටියට ලගින්වත් තියන්න බැරි salary එකක් හම්බෙන්නේ ගොඩක් fields වල ලංකාවේ වගේ රටක. 🥹 IT professionals ල තමයි මේ රටේ ගොඩක්ම වාසනාවන්ත සහ සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන පිරිස. ඒකට හේතු තියනව. 🫡  - ඔබ අවරුදු 4ක degree එකක් හරියට කරලා හරියට skill එක හදාගත්තනම්, ඔබට ඒ skill එකට තමන්ගේ හරියන්නම industry එකේ ජොබ් එක හම්බෙනවා. ඇයි ඒ? හේතුව තමයි පුතා options වැඩි සහ most importantly ඔයාට රජය එක්ක job එක කියන දේට එද්දී ගනුදෙනුවක් නැහැ. රජය හව්ල් නැති තැනක් තියනවනම් මම දකින්නේ එතන වැඩ smooth සහ employees ල උනත් සතුටින්, highly efficient විදියට වැඩ(අදෝනා, දුක් ගැනවිලි, පඩි ප්‍රශ්න නැත.) දැන් බලන්නල, ලගදි උනත් ඔය IT Field එකේ අයට ප්‍රශ්නයක් ආවනම් ආවේ ලංකාවේ ඇතුලේ Firms වල වැඩ කරන LKR salary ගන්න අයට 36% රජයෙන් බදු. සහ ලංකාවෙන් එලියට work කරල Dollar salary ගන්න අයට අලුතෙන් tax එකක් ගැහුව නොතිබුන. කොහොමහරි කියන්න ඕන උනේ බලන්න මගේ පුතේ Government එකක් හව්ල් උනොත් හෝ සම්භන්ධතාවයක් ඇති උනොත් එතන අවුලක්. 🤣 ඉතින් IT Professionals ල පට්ට සතුටු වෙන්න ඕන, තමන්ට ගොඩක් options තියන එක ගැන. ලංකාවේ 99% අනෙකුත් field වලට එහෙම options අඩුයි පුතා. තිබ්බත් 🚀 Mastering Java Collection Framework for Interviews & DevelopmentOne of the most frequently asked topics in Java interviews is the Collection Framework. Understanding its hierarchy and use cases is crucial for writing efficient code. Let’s break it down! 1️⃣ Foundation: Collection Framework OverviewThe Java Collection Framework (JCF) provides a standard architecture for storing and manipulating data.✅ Collection<E> → Root interface for Lists, Sets & Queues✅ Map<K, V> → Stores key-value pairs (not part of Collection)2️⃣ Lists – Ordered & Allows DuplicatesUsed when insertion order matters.✔ ArrayList – Fast random access (O(1) get).✔ LinkedList – Efficient insertions/deletions.✔ Stack – LIFO structure (extends Vector).🔹 Interview Question: Why is ArrayList preferred over LinkedList?👉 Use ArrayList for fast lookups, LinkedList for frequent insertions.3️⃣ Sets – Unique Elements (No Duplicates)✔ HashSet – Unordered, backed by HashMap.✔ LinkedHashSet – Maintains insertion order.✔ TreeSet – Sorted order, O(log N) operations.🔹 Q: How does HashSet ensure uniqueness?👉 Uses hashing internally to store elements.4️⃣ Queues & Deques – FIFO/LIFO✔ PriorityQueue – Elements sorted via heap.✔ ArrayDeque – Efficient queue & stack ops.🔹 Q: How does PriorityQueue maintain sorting?👉 Uses binary heap internally.5️⃣ Maps – Key-Value Pairs (Not in Collection Interface)✔ HashMap – Fast lookups, O(1) avg time.✔ TreeMap – Sorted keys, O(log N) operations.✔ ConcurrentHashMap – Thread-safe alternative to HashMap.🔹 Q: Why prefer ConcurrentHashMap over Hashtable?👉 Less locking, better performance in concurrency.🔍 Why It’s Important?Java interviews often expect in-depth knowledge of ArrayList, HashMap, HashSet, and their internal workings.💡 I personally referred to Shrayansh Jain’s Collection Framework videos & Riddhi Dutta’s Collection Framework video, during my interview preparation! Do watch them if you need in-depth understanding. I've been sharing essential Core Java resources for interview preparation. Follow me to stay updated with more insights and ace your interviews! 🎯 Happy Learning!hashtag#Java hashtag#Collections hashtag#CodingInterviews hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Hashing hashtag#SystemDesign 🚀

Post Content: Remote and hybrid teams present unique challenges for keeping employees connected and maintaining high morale. See these suggestions for managing a remote team effectively. https://bit.ly/3Xs43Zy

It’s a real shame when a potentially good candidate for a remote team member role pulls out of the selection process for a silly reason. That costs both them and their potential employer a great opportunity.Here’s a recent example.Here at Prominence Global, we were helping a client whose business is based in Australia to market a role based overseas.We sourced a large number of well-qualified candidates based in the relevant region and invited the best of them to complete a recorded video interview.Two of them withdrew, refusing to be “subjected to a video interview”.That struck me as more than a little odd for people who would most likely never meet the employer in person and all communication would be exclusively via video conferencing!What puzzling or silly reasons have you seen candidates give for withdrawing their applications?

Username: Gilmar Rodrigues de SousaGilmar Rodrigues de Sousa
Post Content:
The shift to remote work has been a game-changer for many professionals, especially those balancing family life and career. For parents, particularly those with babies and young children, working from home offers a level of flexibility that was previously unimaginable. It allows us to be present for key moments, whether it's attending to a newborn’s needs or simply spending quality time with loved ones.Remote work has provided the opportunity to eliminate long commutes, freeing up valuable time that can now be spent on family priorities. This not only enhances work-life balance, but also leads to increased productivity. The ability to create a more comfortable and personalized work environment makes it easier to focus on professional tasks while meeting family needs.For recruiters, this demonstrates the growing value of offering flexible work options. It empowers employees to thrive in both their professional and personal lives, creating a motivated and loyal workforce. The future of work is not just about being in the office—it's about trusting employees to manage their time effectively and perform at their best, no matter where they are.

🚀 Mastering Java Collection Framework for Interviews & DevelopmentOne of the most frequently asked topics in Java interviews is the Collection Framework. Understanding its hierarchy and use cases is crucial for writing efficient code. Let’s break it down! 1️⃣ Foundation: Collection Framework OverviewThe Java Collection Framework (JCF) provides a standard architecture for storing and manipulating data.✅ Collection<E> → Root interface for Lists, Sets & Queues✅ Map<K, V> → Stores key-value pairs (not part of Collection)2️⃣ Lists – Ordered & Allows DuplicatesUsed when insertion order matters.✔ ArrayList – Fast random access (O(1) get).✔ LinkedList – Efficient insertions/deletions.✔ Stack – LIFO structure (extends Vector).🔹 Interview Question: Why is ArrayList preferred over LinkedList?👉 Use ArrayList for fast lookups, LinkedList for frequent insertions.3️⃣ Sets – Unique Elements (No Duplicates)✔ HashSet – Unordered, backed by HashMap.✔ LinkedHashSet – Maintains insertion order.✔ TreeSet – Sorted order, O(log N) operations.🔹 Q: How does HashSet ensure uniqueness?👉 Uses hashing internally to store elements.4️⃣ Queues & Deques – FIFO/LIFO✔ PriorityQueue – Elements sorted via heap.✔ ArrayDeque – Efficient queue & stack ops.🔹 Q: How does PriorityQueue maintain sorting?👉 Uses binary heap internally.5️⃣ Maps – Key-Value Pairs (Not in Collection Interface)✔ HashMap – Fast lookups, O(1) avg time.✔ TreeMap – Sorted keys, O(log N) operations.✔ ConcurrentHashMap – Thread-safe alternative to HashMap.🔹 Q: Why prefer ConcurrentHashMap over Hashtable?👉 Less locking, better performance in concurrency.🔍 Why It’s Important?Java interviews often expect in-depth knowledge of ArrayList, HashMap, HashSet, and their internal workings.💡 I personally referred to Shrayansh Jain’s Collection Framework videos & Riddhi Dutta’s Collection Framework video, during my interview preparation! Do watch them if you need in-depth understanding. I've been sharing essential Core Java resources for interview preparation. Follow me to stay updated with more insights and ace your interviews! 🎯 Happy Learning!hashtag#Java hashtag#Collections hashtag#CodingInterviews hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Hashing hashtag#SystemDesign 🚀

Post Content: Remote and hybrid teams present unique challenges for keeping employees connected and maintaining high morale. See these suggestions for managing a remote team effectively. https://bit.ly/3Xs43Zy

It’s a real shame when a potentially good candidate for a remote team member role pulls out of the selection process for a silly reason. That costs both them and their potential employer a great opportunity.Here’s a recent example.Here at Prominence Global, we were helping a client whose business is based in Australia to market a role based overseas.We sourced a large number of well-qualified candidates based in the relevant region and invited the best of them to complete a recorded video interview.Two of them withdrew, refusing to be “subjected to a video interview”.That struck me as more than a little odd for people who would most likely never meet the employer in person and all communication would be exclusively via video conferencing!What puzzling or silly reasons have you seen candidates give for withdrawing their applications?

Username: Gilmar Rodrigues de SousaGilmar Rodrigues de Sousa
Post Content:
The shift to remote work has been a game-changer for many professionals, especially those balancing family life and career. For parents, particularly those with babies and young children, working from home offers a level of flexibility that was previously unimaginable. It allows us to be present for key moments, whether it's attending to a newborn’s needs or simply spending quality time with loved ones.Remote work has provided the opportunity to eliminate long commutes, freeing up valuable time that can now be spent on family priorities. This not only enhances work-life balance, but also leads to increased productivity. The ability to create a more comfortable and personalized work environment makes it easier to focus on professional tasks while meeting family needs.For recruiters, this demonstrates the growing value of offering flexible work options. It empowers employees to thrive in both their professional and personal lives, creating a motivated and loyal workforce. The future of work is not just about being in the office—it's about trusting employees to manage their time effectively and perform at their best, no matter where they are.

🚀 Mastering Java Collection Framework for Interviews & DevelopmentOne of the most frequently asked topics in Java interviews is the Collection Framework. Understanding its hierarchy and use cases is crucial for writing efficient code. Let’s break it down! 1️⃣ Foundation: Collection Framework OverviewThe Java Collection Framework (JCF) provides a standard architecture for storing and manipulating data.✅ Collection<E> → Root interface for Lists, Sets & Queues✅ Map<K, V> → Stores key-value pairs (not part of Collection)2️⃣ Lists – Ordered & Allows DuplicatesUsed when insertion order matters.✔ ArrayList – Fast random access (O(1) get).✔ LinkedList – Efficient insertions/deletions.✔ Stack – LIFO structure (extends Vector).🔹 Interview Question: Why is ArrayList preferred over LinkedList?👉 Use ArrayList for fast lookups, LinkedList for frequent insertions.3️⃣ Sets – Unique Elements (No Duplicates)✔ HashSet – Unordered, backed by HashMap.✔ LinkedHashSet – Maintains insertion order.✔ TreeSet – Sorted order, O(log N) operations.🔹 Q: How does HashSet ensure uniqueness?👉 Uses hashing internally to store elements.4️⃣ Queues & Deques – FIFO/LIFO✔ PriorityQueue – Elements sorted via heap.✔ ArrayDeque – Efficient queue & stack ops.🔹 Q: How does PriorityQueue maintain sorting?👉 Uses binary heap internally.5️⃣ Maps – Key-Value Pairs (Not in Collection Interface)✔ HashMap – Fast lookups, O(1) avg time.✔ TreeMap – Sorted keys, O(log N) operations.✔ ConcurrentHashMap – Thread-safe alternative to HashMap.🔹 Q: Why prefer ConcurrentHashMap over Hashtable?👉 Less locking, better performance in concurrency.🔍 Why It’s Important?Java interviews often expect in-depth knowledge of ArrayList, HashMap, HashSet, and their internal workings.💡 I personally referred to Shrayansh Jain’s Collection Framework videos & Riddhi Dutta’s Collection Framework video, during my interview preparation! Do watch them if you need in-depth understanding. I've been sharing essential Core Java resources for interview preparation. Follow me to stay updated with more insights and ace your interviews! 🎯 Happy Learning!hashtag#Java hashtag#Collections hashtag#CodingInterviews hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Hashing hashtag#SystemDesign 🚀

Post Content: Remote and hybrid teams present unique challenges for keeping employees connected and maintaining high morale. See these suggestions for managing a remote team effectively. https://bit.ly/3Xs43Zy

It’s a real shame when a potentially good candidate for a remote team member role pulls out of the selection process for a silly reason. That costs both them and their potential employer a great opportunity.Here’s a recent example.Here at Prominence Global, we were helping a client whose business is based in Australia to market a role based overseas.We sourced a large number of well-qualified candidates based in the relevant region and invited the best of them to complete a recorded video interview.Two of them withdrew, refusing to be “subjected to a video interview”.That struck me as more than a little odd for people who would most likely never meet the employer in person and all communication would be exclusively via video conferencing!What puzzling or silly reasons have you seen candidates give for withdrawing their applications?

Username: Gilmar Rodrigues de SousaGilmar Rodrigues de Sousa
Post Content:
The shift to remote work has been a game-changer for many professionals, especially those balancing family life and career. For parents, particularly those with babies and young children, working from home offers a level of flexibility that was previously unimaginable. It allows us to be present for key moments, whether it's attending to a newborn’s needs or simply spending quality time with loved ones.Remote work has provided the opportunity to eliminate long commutes, freeing up valuable time that can now be spent on family priorities. This not only enhances work-life balance, but also leads to increased productivity. The ability to create a more comfortable and personalized work environment makes it easier to focus on professional tasks while meeting family needs.For recruiters, this demonstrates the growing value of offering flexible work options. It empowers employees to thrive in both their professional and personal lives, creating a motivated and loyal workforce. The future of work is not just about being in the office—it's about trusting employees to manage their time effectively and perform at their best, no matter where they are.

IT Professionals , මොනව උනත් සතුටු විය යුතුම පිරිසක් ලංකාවේ ඉන්න. පුතා, ඔයාල දන්නවද අද වෙද්දී ලංකාවේ කොච්චර පිරිසක් unhappy ද කියල කරන ජොබ් එක ගැන, සමහරවිට අවරුදු 4ක් අපි වගේම හෝ ඊටත් වඩා degrees වලට වෙහෙසිලා, (මෙතැනදී මම උදාහරනෙකට කියන්නේ Doctor කෙනෙක් වගේ උනත් ගත්තොත් ), ඊට පස්සේ එයාගේ අදාල industry එකට එනවා, ආවම සමහරවිට තියෙන්නේ දුක්කිත තත්වයක්.. දෙන service එකේ හැටියට ලගින්වත් තියන්න බැරි
